title: Bring back weatherman
text: I used to use this app alot but I might have to switch due to “Weatherman” by Hank Williams jr. And hasn’t given a formal reason why. This song is very special to me and helped me through hard times the song brought me hope. Now I can’t listen to it just because some reason that they won’t explain. I think I speak for alot of people when I say this was a horrible decision on spotify’s part. Whether it was intentional or just a legal move. I am extremely disappointed. Please bring back the weatherman spotify.

title: Okay, but there’s always room for improvement.
text: I love the app, but unfortunately, even if I have over 200 songs on a playlist, it will still play the same songs. Maybe you could program it to randomly pick a song and then once the song has played, delete it and then once the playlist has gone through all the songs, replay the song picker or whatever and go from there so the same songs aren’t playing every 15 minutes.

title: Bluetooth scratchy as F
text: When I first started using this app with my Kenwood stereo in my truck, it worked flawlessly with blue tooth and apple play. Now neither one will work. Applyplay just sits there no matter what button I hit. Bluetooth shows it playing, but no sound! There are a lot of reports of this on google! Fix it!

title: On a subscription but still see in app ads
text: - Paid for a subscription but still see ads for concerts, new podcasts, or new subscription plans for duos. This is regardless of the notification settings in app being turn off for them. This this a bug or a feature Spotify? Because this has been around for the last several months with no resolution from support past the “go to notification settings”. Past that, the app is good and is easy to navigate around on. Has more then enough music to find stuff you like. Only recommendation is to make a separate app or tab for podcasts. I don’t want to see podcasts on my music app.

title: My Spotify Opinion
text: I enjoy using Spotify on my console, but on my phone, the experience is marred by frequent annoying unskippable ads that pop up, prompting me to switch to YouTube, which offers skippable ads. Another issue I have with the app is the difficulty in finding slowed/sped up or remixed songs, which can be annoying at times.
